item.title: Make Grub Font Size Bigger
item.description: By default Ubuntu/ElementaryOS configure their GRUB to use very small fonts. That really hurts my eyes. I decided to play with GRUB and increase the font size. The process is rather straight forward: Generate a GRUB-compatible font with specified size from a TTF (type-type font) Edit high-level GRUB configuration file Regenerate low-level GRUB configurations Restart and enjoy fruit of your labour I chose a mono-space font with size 36pt: DejaVuSansMono.
